instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-3437 with no backlight
threads.message: I have a 820-3437 water damaged.  Ran it through ultrasonic and replaced nasty looking C7796, but still no backlight.  Checked bklt fuse its fine, C7796, C7797, C7799 all measuring correctly.  I can not seem to find anything else wrong. Please help.

threads.title: 820-3437 with no backlight
threads.message: Values on diode mode before D9701 and after D9701 to GND?

threads.title: 820-3437 with no backlight
threads.message: forgive me for newbie question- but I can not find d9701??

threads.title: 820-3437 with no backlight
threads.message: Duke means D7701

threads.title: 820-3437 with no backlight
threads.message: What is the voltage output on C7799? If it is 8.4 then I suspect a dead LP8550

threads.title: 820-3437 with no backlight
threads.message:
.411 is too low. .400 to .475 signify bad feedback line to lp8550. 0.511-0.545 is what you want after the diode. What does ball A5 for feedback on lp8550 look like?

Also, what is your backlight voltage? 0v, 8.4v, 19v, 27v, or 49v?

0v means break in line or being told to stay off altogether.

8.4v means no boosting, but continuity all the way through on the top of the line from coil to diode, diode to output, etc.

19v means missing pwm or bad lp8550

27v means we're blind :)

49v means bad lcd/lcd backlight cable inside assembly is not plugged in/bad cable.

threads.title: 820-3437 with no backlight
threads.message: voltage is 8.4v

threads.title: 820-3437 with no backlight
threads.message: ball A5 looks ok

threads.title: 820-3437 with no backlight
threads.message:
[QUOTE="larossmann, post: 270"].411 is too low. .400 to .475 signify bad feedback line to lp8550. 0.511-0.545 is what you want after the diode. What does ball A5 for feedback on lp8550 look like?

Also, what is your backlight voltage? 0v, 8.4v, 19v, 27v, or 49v?

0v means break in line or being told to stay off altogether.

[COLOR=#B22222]8.4v means no boosting, but continuity all the way through on the top of the line from coil to diode, diode to output, etc.[/COLOR]

19v means missing pwm or bad lp8550

27v means we're blind :)

49v means bad lcd/lcd backlight cable inside assembly is not plugged in/bad cable.[/QUOTE]

8.4v means no boosting

threads.title: 820-3437 with no backlight
threads.message: I just want to verify LP8550 is bad before replacing it

threads.title: 820-3437 with no backlight
threads.message: continuity test in diode mode, if beeps is ok if not is open, if you press "N" key on landrex  and give the name of the net you are looking for, it will tell you all the places where this net should be...

threads.title: 820-3437 with no backlight
threads.message: thank you!

threads.title: 820-3437 with no backlight
threads.message: One way to find out for sure is to pull the 8550 and measure feedback lines before and after diode to the 8550 pads. But before you do that you can check BKL_EN and BKL_PWM. I still think this is going to be a bad 8550.

threads.message: Did you verify the feedback lines when the 8550 was off the board? Did you use a new 8550?

threads.title: 820-3437 with no backlight
threads.message: no i do not have any new ones i pulled 8550 from another board

threads.title: 820-3437 with no backlight
threads.message: I just ordered new ones, I also measured before and after D7701 with 8550 off, I receive 8.54V on both sides

threads.title: 820-3437 with no backlight
threads.message: The new LP8550s come pre balled. You may not have enough solder on all of the pins of the pulled LP8550. I'm having similar issue...just waiting on the new LP8550s so I can test the issue before posting a thread about it.

threads.title: 820-3437 with no backlight
threads.message: Reballing the lp8550 requires a level of skill not worth investing for a chip that is $1.61 new with balls. Try again with new chip.

threads.title: 820-3437 with no backlight
threads.message: I have replaced lp8550 with new one and still no back light
